Sentencas: When all the cell components are fired at a single step, better performance is expected as the interfaces between the adjacent components not only provide better adhesion, but also offer good morphological features and properties.
Titulo: Interface reactions during co-firing of solid oxide fuel cell components

Sentencas: The present investigation is an attempt towards fabrication of such types of cells.
Titulo: Interface reactions during co-firing of solid oxide fuel cell components

Sentencas: A new cathode composition, LaNi(0.6)Fe(0.4)O(3) (LNF), is used instead of conventional La(Sr)MnO(3) (LSM).
Titulo: Interface reactions during co-firing of solid oxide fuel cell components

Sentencas: However, following a co-deposition and single-step firing, unit cells with LNF cathode produce no voltage output when electrochemical tests are performed.
Titulo: Interface reactions during co-firing of solid oxide fuel cell components

Sentencas: The reason for this adverse result was analyzed and the microstructural analyses showed a thick white gas-tight film at the interface between the zirconia (electrolyte) and LSM-YSZ (cathode).
Titulo: Interface reactions during co-firing of solid oxide fuel cell components

Sentencas: This white layer starts forming at similar to1300 degreesC and becomes thicker and thicker as the sintering temperature increases.
Titulo: Interface reactions during co-firing of solid oxide fuel cell components

Sentencas: Samples co-fired at 1400 degreesC for 5 h yield a white layer of thickness similar to2 mum.
Titulo: Interface reactions during co-firing of solid oxide fuel cell components

Sentencas: Quantitative EDX and XRD analysis confirmed the formation of the La(2)Zr(2)O(7) reaction phase which is the reason for such poor performance.
Titulo: Interface reactions during co-firing of solid oxide fuel cell components

Sentencas: LNF could have emerged as the SOFC cathode material of choice because of its favorable properties, but it is problematic when fabricated along with other cell components (as in the presentation investigation).
Titulo: Interface reactions during co-firing of solid oxide fuel cell components
